intro: Lepidium bonariense f. reductum, commonly known as the reduced wallflower, is a compact, low-growing perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically features dense,丛生 foliage with dark green, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or borders. Its ornamental value comes from its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in early spring.
